pullRequest.title: Adding support for secrets in pluggable scm materials
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue: #8234
Description:

added pluggable_scm as an entity for secrets rules
added support for secrets in plugin configurations
resolved values will be send to the plugin while MDU
MDU: will pass if the pluggable scm config is allowed access to secret config
pipeline will get triggered on successful MDU

Plugin UI
Since the view comes from the plugin, the plugin has to be updated in order to allow users to view unmasked values for secure configurations while editing

nodes.bodyText:
Reason behind introducing a new method: parsing of a secret param and substituting the same needs to check the following cases:

not secure values: null nd not blank
secure values: null nd successful decryption.

These checks are already performed in getValue() method. Hence, to avoid code duplication, decided to introduce a new method. Let me know if this is not ok.

nodes.bodyText: Also, this method is required because there are places wherein we just need the value configured(e.g in API's) and there are times when we would need the values to resolved if it contains secrets (e.g during MDU the resolved values needs to be sent to the plugin)
Can we change configurationProperty.isSecure to have an additional check for secretParams over calling configurationProperty.hasSecretParams()
Can we have a resolve method on SecretParamResolver which takes any type of material over having multiple methods for each material type.
Do not log an error here. We are throwing an exception, leave it to services to handle exception and log errors.
Does it make sense to move hasSecretParams() check inside the resolve method?

commit.message:
Add support for secrets in plugin configs
  - Make ConfigurationProperty implement SecretParamAware
  - add getResolvedValue method which will give the resolved value

Adding support for secrets in pluggable scm materials
  - updated the entity for secret config rules to include `pluggable_scm`.
  - resolved values will be send to the plugin while MDU
  - MDU: will pass if the pluggable scm config is allowed access to secret config
  - pipeline will get triggered on successful MDU
Update secret configs API to v2 as we are introducing support for pluggable scms
Update the secret config UI to support pluggable scm

Changes:
 - resolve pluggable scm materials before creating build assignment as the scm configs are added to the intial environmental context
